digest_items.title: Scan dependencies for vulnerabilities
digest_items.why: Vulnerable dependencies are a common attack vector in supply chain attacks
digest_items.fix: Use tools like npm audit, pip-audit, or Snyk in your CI/CD pipeline

digest_items.title: Use principle of least privilege
digest_items.why: Excessive permissions increase blast radius of compromised accounts
digest_items.fix: Grant only minimum necessary permissions for each role

digest_items.title: Implement API authentication
digest_items.why: Unauthenticated APIs allow unauthorized access to data and functions
digest_items.fix: Use OAuth 2.0, JWT tokens, or API keys with proper validation

digest_items.title: Implement DMARC policy
digest_items.why: DMARC builds on SPF and DKIM to give domain owners control over email authentication

digest_items.title: Implement security monitoring
digest_items.why: Real-time monitoring detects attacks and anomalies early
digest_items.fix: Use SIEM tools and set up alerts for suspicious activities

digest_items.title: Implement session timeout
digest_items.why: Long-lived sessions increase risk of session hijacking
digest_items.fix: Set session timeout to 15-30 minutes for sensitive applications

digest_items.title: Use secure random number generation
digest_items.fix: Use crypto.randomBytes() or secrets module, not Math.random()

digest_items.title: Remove default credentials
digest_items.why: Default passwords are publicly known and exploited by automated scanners
digest_items.fix: Change all default passwords immediately after deployment
